summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 between defense attorney Bruce Barket and a Bureau of Prisons official, with a forwarded inquiry from a Daily Beast editor. Barket suggests false information about his client Nicholas Tartaglione being questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) was leaked from the facility.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione; sends email complaining about leaked false information regarding his client being questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

persons.name: Adam Johnson
persons.context: Recipient of Bruce Barket's email, appears to be a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) official based on email address domain.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of a news story alleging Nicholas Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on him while both were held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Client of attorney Bruce Barket; alleged in a news story to have been questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein while both were incarcerated at MCC.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Executive editor at The Daily Beast who forwarded an inquiry to Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story about his client being questioned regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney representing inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, as indicated in his complaint about leaked information.
Both were reportedly held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), and Tartaglione was allegedly questioned about a possible attack on Epstein.

events.title: Daily Beast Inquiry Regarding Epstein/Tartaglione
events.description: Tracy Connor of The Daily Beast emails Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story alleging his client Nicholas Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

events.title: Attorney Complaint About Leaked Information
events.description: Attorney Bruce Barket emails a BOP official complaining that false information about his client Nicholas Tartaglione being questioned about an attack on Jeffrey Epstein was leaked from the MCC facility.

locations: Garden City, NY 11530 (Barket's law firm address)
keyFacts: Attorney Bruce Barket alleges false information was leaked from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding his client Nicholas Tartaglione being questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence references an NBC news story from July 2019 about Tartaglione's alleged interrogation concerning Epstein's safety in custody.
Both Jeffrey Epstein and Nicholas Tartaglione were reportedly held at the MCC in New York in July 2019.
The email chain shows media (The Daily Beast) actively pursuing confirmation of the story about potential inmate violence targeting Epstein.
